title: Pierre Robiglio
text:
Hello there!

I am a PhD student in Economics at Rome Economics Doctorate (RED), a program jointly run by EIEF, LUISS and Tor Vergata.


My research interests are Labor Economics and Industrial Organizations. My JMP, co-authored with with Edoardo Scalcione, is at the intersection of these two fields; we use administrative data to study the labor implications of a collusive scheme in the Portuguese labor market.


My supervisors are Matteo Paradisi and Emilio Calvano.







TipGet in touch!



Feel free to reach out if you have any questions/comments/ideas, or just want to say hello!






News

02/09/2025 - Presented our work on no-poaching agreements to a team of lawyers and economists from the Cartel Unit at DG COMP.
19/07/2025 - I thank the Chief Economist Team at DG COMP for allowing me to present our work on cartels in the labor market during their weekly meeting!.
01/06/2025 - Officially started my PhD traineeship at the Merger Unit of the Chief Economist Team at DG COMP.
27/05/2025 - First presentation of our work on no-poaching agreements in front of the always active EIEF audience.
03/06/2025 - Upcoming talk at NetSci 2025 by Martina on our work on internal migrations in Austria.
29/05/2025 - Upcoming talk at TopoNets 2025.
19/05/2025 - The 11th edition of Data Stories is happening tomorrow!
31/03/2025 - Our article “Synergistic Signatures of Group Mechanisms in Higher-Order Systems” has been published in PRL as an Editors’ suggestion. Our work is also featured in Physics.
28/02/2025 - I gave a talk at the Namur Institute for Complex Systems.
30/01/2025 - Our manuscript “Synergistic signatures of group mechanisms in higher-order systems” has been accepted in Physical Review Letters.
07/06/2024 - Today I have passed my comprehensive exam, succesfully defending my PhD thesis research proposal! (you can also check the material from my recent departmental seminar talk about it)
